text: The lieutenant governor of American Samoa is the second highest-ranking political figure in American Samoa, behind the governor. ==List of lieutenant governors of American Samoa== ===Appointed lieutenant governors=== * Frank Barnett (Democrat, 1974â€“76) ===Elected lieutenant governors=== Image Name Political party Term started Term ended Notes Tufele Liamatua Republican January 3, 1978 January 3, 1985 First elected lt. governor of American Samoa Eni Faleomavaega Democratic January 3, 1985 January 2, 1989 Galea'i Peni Poumele Republican January 2, 1989 July 27, 1992 Poumele died in office in July 1992. Gaioi Tufele Galeai Republican August 1992 January 4, 1993 Widow of Lt. Governor Galea'i Peni Poumele. Served the remainder of Poumele's unexpired term Tauese Sunia Democratic January 4, 1993 January 3, 1997 Togiola Tulafono Democratic January 3, 1997 March 26, 2003 Acting governor from March 26, 2003, to April 7, 2003, following the death of Governor Tauese Sunia. colspan=6 Faoa Aitofele Sunia Democratic April 11, 2003 January 3, 2013 Lemanu Peleti Mauga Independent January 3, 2013 January 3, 2021 Lemanu Peleti Mauga Democratic January 3, 2013 January 3, 2021 Salo Ale Democratic January 3, 2021 Janurary 3, 2025 Salo Ale Democratic January 3, 2021 Janurary 3, 2025 Pulu Ae Ae Unknown Republican January 3, 2025 Incumbent January 3, 2025 Incumbent ==References==
title: Lieutenant Governor of American Samoa
